body_html:
I believe Bazel does pass the arguments as
C:\msys64\usr\bin\bash.exe -l -c "patch -p1 -d C:/users/tao/_bazel_tao/ic7qrvhc/external/png_archive -i G:/tensorflow/third_party/png_fix_rpi.patch"

It's just missing the quotes when printing the command in terminal.

Can you try to add -f here:
tensorflow/third_party/repo.bzl

Line 71 in f1d42c8

["patch", "-p1", "-d", ctx.path("."), "-i", ctx.path(patch_file)],

like:
["patch", "-f", "-p1", "-d", ctx.path("."), "-i", ctx.path(patch_file)],

Can provide tensorflow.dll and tensorflow.lib for windows tensorflow, preferably DEBUG version？thx.
body_text:
I believe Bazel does pass the arguments as
C:\msys64\usr\bin\bash.exe -l -c "patch -p1 -d C:/users/tao/_bazel_tao/ic7qrvhc/external/png_archive -i G:/tensorflow/third_party/png_fix_rpi.patch"
It's just missing the quotes when printing the command in terminal.
Can you try to add -f here:
tensorflow/third_party/repo.bzl
Line 71 in f1d42c8
["patch", "-p1", "-d", ctx.path("."), "-i", ctx.path(patch_file)],
like:
["patch", "-f", "-p1", "-d", ctx.path("."), "-i", ctx.path(patch_file)],

Can provide tensorflow.dll and tensorflow.lib for windows tensorflow, preferably DEBUG version？thx.
body:
> I believe Bazel does pass the arguments as
> `C:\msys64\usr\bin\bash.exe -l -c "patch -p1 -d C:/users/tao/_bazel_tao/ic7qrvhc/external/png_archive -i G:/tensorflow/third_party/png_fix_rpi.patch"`
> 
> It's just missing the quotes when printing the command in terminal.
> 
> Can you try to add `-f` here:
> [tensorflow/third_party/repo.bzl](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/f1d42c8967410db1e08c0b6d62dc1fc4844165a8/third_party/repo.bzl#L71)
> 
> Line 71 in [f1d42c8](/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/f1d42c8967410db1e08c0b6d62dc1fc4844165a8)
> 
>  ["patch", "-p1", "-d", ctx.path("."), "-i", ctx.path(patch_file)], 
> 
> like:
> `["patch", "-f", "-p1", "-d", ctx.path("."), "-i", ctx.path(patch_file)],`

Can provide `tensorflow.dll` and `tensorflow.lib` for windows tensorflow, preferably DEBUG version？thx.
